item.title: Hundreds of Classic ‘Sesame Street’ Episodes to Hit YouTube With Sesame Workshop Deal (Exclusive)
item.description: Sesame Workshop will also continue to produce some original content for YouTube, and host workshops with creators to help them create entertaining and educational content.

item.title: Google Hires Filmmaker in Residence as It Seeks Wider Adoption of Flow AI Video Tool
item.description: Filmmaker and creative director Henry Daubrez will join Google Labs to create new content, help shape the Flow product, and lead Flow Sessions with other filmmakers.

item.title: Walmart Wants to Challenge Amazon as a Streaming Aggregator, Adds Peacock as Video Partner
item.description: Walmart+ subscribers will be able to choose between memberships to Peacock and Paramount+, and can switch every 90 days, as the retail giant targets Amazon in the video space.

item.title: Swingers Club: How YouTube Made Golf Cool Again
item.description: With loose-vibes videos showing off player personality (and sometimes cleavage), the platform has reinvented the way golf is consumed for a new generation.

item.title: You’ve Never Heard of Alt-Comedy’s Favorite Writer (He Wants It That Way)
item.description: Mike Sacks’ bizarre books and podcasts have drawn a cult following among celebrities from Jon Hamm to Bob Odenkirk. And if you don’t know his name, well, that’s entirely his fault.

item.title: The 44 Most Powerful Players in Podcasting in 2025

item.title: Who’s Really Winning the Podcast Wars — and How
item.description: The medium is at an inflection point: Investigative deep dives are out, cheaper chitchat is in, and it’s got to be on video to break through: “We’re literally just a bunch of YouTubers now.”

item.title: Who’s Really Winning the Podcast Wars — and How
item.description: The medium is at an inflection point: Investigative deep dives are out, cheaper chitchat is in, and it’s got to be on video to break through: “We’re literally just a bunch of YouTubers now.”

item.title: Who the F*** Is Marc Maron Without Podcasting? He’s About to Find Out
item.description: Sixteen years after his show launched an industry and saved his career, the curmudgeonly conversationalist is feeling conflicted about what followed: “Things were better before everyone had a voice.”

item.title: Behind Wondery’s Break Up: Maximizing Podcast Profit Amid YouTube’s Video Dominance
item.description: The podcasting company, which saw 110 layoffs, is the latest to pivot as the Google-owned video platform ecosystem pushes longform chats as a watchable format.

item.title: Roku Launches Howdy, a $2.99 Monthly Streaming Service
item.description: “Priced at less than a cup of coffee, Howdy is ad-free and designed to complement, not compete with, premium services,” said Roku founder and CEO Anthony Wood.

item.title: Roku Launches Howdy, a $2.99 Monthly Streaming Service
item.description: “Priced at less than a cup of coffee, Howdy is ad-free and designed to complement, not compete with, premium services,” said Roku founder and CEO Anthony Wood.

item.title: Amazon Breaks Up Wondery Podcast Studio, CEO Jen Sargent Departs
item.description: About 110 staffers were cut as part of the move while the team responsible for Wondery’s shows including ‘New Heights,’ ‘Armchair Expert’ will join Amazon’s Talent Services team.

item.title: Amazon Breaks Up Wondery Podcast Studio, CEO Jen Sargent Departs
item.description: About 110 staffers were cut as part of the move while the team responsible for Wondery’s shows including ‘New Heights,’ ‘Armchair Expert’ will join Amazon’s Talent Services team.
